top.author: @TheGamerSection
top.text: Calling all #IndieDevs! We want to feature your game on our #YouTube channel. Interested in sharing your journey and insights? DM us or email gamersectionpodcast@gmail.com to get featured! #GameDev #IndieGame #GamingCommunity

options.comment: Love seeing platforms that spotlight indie creators! The hustle is real and deserves more visibility ğŸ®
Smart move building community around indie devs. Most struggle with marketing/visibility way more than the actual development.
As someone who deals with tons of outreach emails daily, props for providing both DM and email options. Makes it way easier for devs to choose their preferred communication style.

top.author: @PoetCatRussell
top.text: Yesterday, @gmail used AI (unasked) to sum up a email thread where I'd made plans w/a friend. It summed everything up in its own words: I know my emails aren't completely private, but that CREEPED THE HELL OUT OF ME. I turned that "feature" off. I think... #AI #Boundaries

top.author: @jeoste_
top.text: My client just sent me this satisfying email about my "slow shipping" But if I tell my client I need 4 days to do the feature, and they pay me to work 1 day per week, then why are they not happy that it takes 1 month to ship (???)

top.author: @FredSBurrows
top.text: why the hell has Google Workspace been excruciatingly slow lately? like 1-5 second latency with basic operations like opening an email, copy/paste, changing document tabs, highlighting text, search in document, typing at all

options.comment: The irony of waiting 5 seconds to open an email about productivity tips ğŸ’€
Been seeing this across multiple orgs. Chrome extensions, network config, or their backend issues? The Gmail web client seems particularly hit lately.
As someone building email tools, this kind of latency is exactly why we're exploring native clients over web - basic operations shouldn't feel like loading a webpage

top.text: step 1. create an account on https:// zapier.com and create a new automation for the trigger select email parser, set trigger to new email, then connect a new account then go to https:// parser.zapier.com and log in with zapier, and create a mailbox

options.comment: The fact that we need 5+ steps just to parse an email feels like we're overengineering simple problems ğŸ˜…
Email automation workflows are getting complex. The real challenge isn't the setupâ€”it's maintaining these integrations as your needs evolve.
As someone building email tools, I see this complexity all the time. We're exploring ways to make email-to-action workflows more native and less fragmented.

top.author: @beausecurity
top.text: I've been recommending @optery for a while as the best data deletion and privacy tool I've encountered. Don't want your home address, email, or phone number showing up on Google? Here's how it works: 1. Data Brokers and websites collect your data and make it easy for ANYONE to

options.comment: The rabbit hole of data brokers is insane. Found my info on sites I've never heard of with details going back years. It's like digital archaeology, but creepy.

Privacy is becoming a full-time job. Between managing data brokers, email subscriptions, and notification settings, we're spending more time protecting our attention than actually using it productively.

As someone building tools to reduce digital noise, the data broker ecosystem is fascinating and terrifying. Your email ends up everywhere, then you're drowning in notifications from services you never signed up for.

top.author: @venelinkochev
top.text: here is the power of being a solopreneur: I'm in talks with a big enterprise customer for ConvertHub they want to automate file conversions in their workflow I was missing a feature... so I built and shipped it between two of his emails the guy went from first email to

options.comment: The ultimate product-market fit speedrun ğŸƒâ€â™‚ï¸ Nothing beats shipping between customer emails
This is why small teams win. Enterprise moves slow, you move fast. The agility gap becomes your competitive moat.
As someone building productivity tools, this resonates deeply. The magic happens when you can iterate faster than the customer's attention span.
